00107         // these two static functions are needed to work around a restriction
00108         // of C++ that disallows access to protected members of an other
00109         // instance of a base class
00110         // without these functions, we cannot access inferred siblings of
00111         // other nodes
00112         static MMLNode *getNext(MMLNode *n) { return (n) ?n->next :0; }
00113         static MMLNode *getFirst(MMLNode *n) { return (n) ?n->first :0; }
00114         static MMLNode *getLast(MMLNode *n) { return (n) ?n->last :0; }
00115         MMLNode(MMLDocument * const);
00116 private:
00117         MMLNode();
00118         MMLNode(const MMLNode &);
00119         void operator=(const MMLNode &);

00121         // helper functions. These functions are called by the constant and
00122         // non-constant versions. This saves implementation space.
